summary: A confidential letter from Jeffrey Roth to Judge Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's release on bail, arguing for her good character, offering financial security, and claiming she is not a flight risk.

persons.name: Jeffrey Roth
persons.role: Cousin of Ghislaine Maxwell, letter writer
persons.context: Writes a letter to Judge Nathan requesting Ghislaine Maxwell's release on bail, offering $2,000 as bond security and vouching for her character and ties to the community.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the bail request, described by her cousin as innocent, of good character, and not a flight risk, with extreme conditions of confinement.

persons.name: Muin J. Nathan
persons.context: The Honorable Judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York to whom the bail support letter is addressed.

persons.name: Jolene Roth
persons.context: Jeffrey Roth's mother, whose candlesticks were a wedding gift from Ghislaine Maxwell's father, indicating a long family connection.

persons.name: Helene
persons.context: Daughter of Ghislaine Maxwell's Aunt Brans, who stayed with Jeffrey Roth's family when she came to the U.S., showing close family ties.

connections.description: Cousins; Jeffrey Roth describes a close family relationship, dining together a few times a year and vouching for her character in a bail request.
Mother and son; Jeffrey references his mother's connection to Ghislaine Maxwell's family through a wedding gift.
Connection through family; Ghislaine's father gave wedding gift candlesticks to Jolene Roth, indicating a historical family friendship.

events.title: Bail Request for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Jeffrey Roth submits a confidential letter to Judge Nathan requesting Ghislaine Maxwell's release on bail, offering financial security and arguing her innocence and community ties.

events.title: Lunch at Jeffrey Roth's Business
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell visited Jeffrey Roth's place of business in Valley Stream, New York for a lunch, mentioned as a recent social interaction.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Roth, a cousin of Ghislaine Maxwell, wrote a letter to Judge Nathan on November 17, 2020, supporting her release on bail.
Roth offered to put up $2,000 as bond security for Maxwell's bail, despite stating he does not have a lot of cash.
Roth argued that Maxwell's conditions of confinement are extreme and that she is not a flight risk, stating 'she didn't before, she won't'.
The letter emphasizes long-standing family connections, including a wedding gift from Maxwell's father to Roth's mother and close ties with Maxwell's aunt and cousin.
Jeffrey Roth is identified as a staff member at The New York Times, with nearly three decades of work there as an editor, writer, and manager.
